intro: Biscutella lucronensis, commonly known as the Balkan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Biscutella lucronensis is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
